comments.commentBody: to Concerned Citizen: How many liberals have you spoken to- personally? How many have told you they "hate America"? Do you even know any Liberals? Finally, what is wrong with being a Liberal- in your view? Personally, Conservatism isn't all its cracked up to be. I would rather be a raging Liberal on human rights, equity, fairness, preserving the environment; tell me again- what is wrong with that Concerned Citizen...
That washed-up nobody Michael Flynn was pathetic - absolutely BEGGING for a little energy from the listless crowd.
Meanwhile back on Earth, I'll go with the Planned Parenthood candidate.
Coward?  silliness.

I might add, do you consider this fact or fiction?
http://www.nytimes.com/2016/07/17/us/politics/donald-trump-business.html...
Well...in defense of the NRA, Eben,  how many times must those of us who defend the Second Amendment respond to the silliness and nonsense of those that do not?
Apparently Obama, the same guy that is in charge of the Veteran's administration and who as Community Organizer-Chief  prefers that people act out all their discontents.

There are thousands of soldiers that come home each with and 99.99% don't become radicalized and assassinate police officers.

Can you blame them? Yes, I can blame the radicalizers who prey on on the mentally impaired. But I won't blame the military for this.

Another minority war veteran being radicalized. This is about a country who refuses to take care of its broken soldiers. They come home to their broken homes. Can you blame them? Yes, they are sharp shooters and who trained them?
I have heard many a well-intentioned parent say to their young children something similar to "you had better stop that now or I am going to call the police."

Bingo, right there is the issue, support for these people who plan and kill police. Police don't sit around for weeks planning to kill people. They are thrust into uncertain situations which carry a great amount of danger to themselves. No always do they make the correct split second decisions, however the vast majority of the time, probably 99% they do make the right decision.
A cold, planned killing by someone inspired by what appears more and more as a hate group, is incredibly calculated and evil. M you need to get some perspective.

NRA member here. and also ACLU. The NRA has ***never***advocated to "lock and load" against the United States government and its Constitution. While both organizations to which I belong have civil rights and liberties foundations. ,rest assured that they do not advocate the kind of nasty violence against lawful authority that you imply.  On the other hand, the  a convenient whipping boy  and scapegoat for all the dysfunctional. abberent behavior of criminals, so feel free to unfairly accuse.

Stealing from Jim again; this comment being a priceless rejoinder to this kind of thing [ http://www.nytimes.com/2016/07/15/us/politics/hillary-clinton-donald-tru... ] :

Oh, please. Enough already.   

Weak-willed Eve persuades Adam to eat the forbidden fruit. Paradise lost, all because of a woman.   Curious Pandora, "sheer guile, not to be withstood by men," opens the mysterious jar and releases evils into the world. Say goodbye to the Golden Age, all because of a woman.   "Look like th' innocent flower, / But be the serpent under't," Shakespeare's Lady Macbeth advises her king. Disaster ensues, all because of a woman.   And so on, seemingly ad infinitum.   

Are we ever going to reach bottom in this free fall of ours into sheer stupidity? Are we really this clueless and lacking in self-awareness?

  This caricature of Hillary Clinton as a modern-day Lady Macbeth is the creation of the same cabal of white male reactionaries who are eager to hand Donald J. Trump — he of the narcissistic personality disorder — the nuclear codes.

  If you are willing to swallow this misogynistic tripe, you are a misogynist yourself or a dupe, pure and simple.   

Now can we please get on to creating better jobs, narrowing the wealth gap, improving Obamacare, rebuilding our infrastructure, fighting terrorism, remaking the energy sector, repairing the safety net, and coming together as a country?
--
I couldn't have said it better myself!

Mrs. Trump is a former foreign supermodel who studied design in high school.  It is very doubtful that she had to write many if any papers nor give many, if any, speeches. English is not her native language. America is not her native country. Third wife as First Lady?

"Or could be, Democrats will win because nobody likes a bully!"

We have two bullies running this year.

Nice T and A?

What else was awesome?

While I generally vote Republican I am convinced the Democrats will win because of the infighting and division in this party. You have Cruz voters that despise Trump and will sit it out, same with several other candidates. Never before have we seen such division this far into the process. Mrs. Trump was awesome though, really good.

I remember first being introduced to the drink at a festival called Pony Days held in a small quasi ghost town in Montana 7 years ago. Since then it seems that the popularity of the drink follows me wherever I move. I think the drink has come back into vogue not because of from some hipster fad of the year but because its an incredibly tasty, refreshing and versatile cocktail. You can make a Dark and Stormy with Rum, or a Kentucky Mule with Bourbon. No need to stick with just straight vodka. My favorite rendition of it is to muddle fresh cucumber and blueberries to the drink. It makes for an incredibly delicious Summer cocktail.
Next week it's the Democratic's turn. Dems will deliver on Melania's plea to the GOP: “It is kindness, love and compassion for each other that will bring us together and keep us together."
Too bad you depend on others to tell you what happened instead of watching for yourself.

NYT, can you just stop being part of the whole election circus? The two years it takes until the election is a welcome diversion of the real and solvable problems of the people living in the United States. But I guess, the elite isn't interesting in improving anything but for themselves.
Owen: I hope all that will sustain you in the economy, housing market; job market and health-care system.
You're referring to the Iraq war Hillary supported?
I, for one, was moved by her speech felt that she clearly wanted to share her story. Why shouldn't she be permitted to do so if she wanted to?
The irony, as Clinton prepares to use the mother of Michael Brown, who few would call an upstanding citizen

“I blame Hillary Clinton personally for the death of my son"

To use the anguish of a mother who has lost her son to further Mr Trump's ravenous political ambitions is about as low as you can get. How many times could you multiply that anguish by all the mothers who lost their sons in a cooked up Iraq war by the Republican Bush/Cheney administration. The Republicans really know how to dishonorably wear the flag by providing the country with chickenhawks at or near the top of their ticket such as Bush, Cheney, and Trump. Trump is the biggest smear artist to ever run for the modern day Presidency. There are no boundaries for this guy. The other day he implied our President was a bigot towards white police officers. The people who give a full throated roar of approval for Trump's tactics should send the chills down the spines of all thinking Americans.
Naming rights to various venues go to the highest bidder, but it seems exceptionally appropriate that this year's Republican National Convention is being held at the Quicken Loans Pavilion.
Agree, we should not be hearing the slamming from a minister. Totally agree with you on that.

When do we hear from the families whose kids in military service were killed in Dick Cheney's adventure in Iraq? There are thousands to choose from.

Until then, I'll keep tuning out whenever I hear the word Benghazi.
Well talk about C-List reality TV celebrities & a cover band, how embarrassing for Trump...is this the best he could come up with? Pretty lame support team.

...'cept it's "We the People" who are ultimately being "punked".
We watch as our democracy circles the drain.

I wish Trump had the moral character and conscience to be "secretly halfway embarrassed" by the lineup. But since Trump never makes mistakes and never thinks anybody who admires him is wrong (ala David Duke), I doubt he was embarrassed, secretly or otherwise, by any of those (by and large) hateful speakers.

I love reality TV and all but there is a time and a place for everything. Tonight we had Sean from The Real World Boston - who is apparently an actual Congressman and married to Rachel from The Real World San Francisco? How did this happen, America? - and they're on stage at the RNC convention making Hillary Clinton jokes?

I'm not sure a national political convention is the right place for these folks. I think Mr. Trump is secretly halfway embarrassed by this lineup - all of them, not just the reality people. Not because of what they're saying (which is relentlessly tasteless), but because they're not the A-list he loves. I know Scott Baio was on the TV show Happy Days but I know him from his reality show on VH1. He was a bit off then, too. And were any of these speakers - not just the reality ones - well-versed on issues other than hate and bitterness? It appears not.

So what other people is Mr. Trump going to push up there? Omarosa? I see today she has been made his director of African-American "outreach". Yep, that's gonna work! The longer this campaign goes on it seems more and more like a remake season of "Punk'd". Is Ashton Kutcher in Cleveland filming this? It wouldn't surprise me one bit.

Let us start with the anemic economic growth, you seem to think it is due to something Obama did not do.

I suggest you look at "Activist Investors." most of whom are fund managers who buy enough shares of a company to be able to influence the Board of Directors, and even get some of them removed and replaced with their own people.

They then get the company to buyback shares increasing their price using shareholder pressure to do so, and as much of the company's cash and reserve they can get away with. This is money the company's need for research and expansion, but is is used up and these investors sell reaping big gains and getting a tax break called "Carried Interest." They are short term investors, billionaires who keep the job market from growing.

Obama can not grow the job market, or any market, it is investors who do that, and these investors keep it from growing.

Nowhere in history can you find GOP administrations bringing economic growth.
Uhhhh if it was so easy where's the rest of the field?
if you always answer your own questions why bother asking them
